description.narrative: The broad goal of DESMI’s work is to empower the indigenous communities, especially women, to enact positive change in their social and livelihood conditions. According to their most recent Strategic Plan, DESMI’s goals and objectives are: 1) Food Security: Using sustainable agricultural techniques, local skill and resources, DESMI’s objective is to achieve food self sufficiency for peasant and indigenous communities in the region; 2) Community Development: DESMI’s goal is to build the capacity and skills for holistic transformation in communities; to support collective work that meets the livelihood and economic development needs of the communities; 3) Knowledge Sharing: DESMI plans to systematize all experiences of work and include it in different publications like pamphlets, books, and manuals to guide community workers, community members, and to codify this knowledge for future generations; and 4) Organizational Capacity: DESMI’s goal is to strengthen the abilities and skills of its operational team to better serve committees, solidarity networks, as well as develop relationships with funders A part of this grant went to support DESMI staff to attend the Brazil Agroecology Learning Exchange in August 2014.
